intro: Duranta erecta var. alba, commonly known as White Beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its striking clusters of white, tubular flowers that appear in late summer to early fall. The plant produces small, bright blue berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant floral display. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a popular choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes.
